Term.Name: GENERAL AUDIENCE
Term.Definition: Programmes not intended for a specific target group.

Term.Name: AGE GROUPS
Term.Definition: The age group levels for which the programme is primarily intended..

Term.Name: age 4-7
Term.Definition: Age ranges are indicative and may vary slightly in each country

Term.Name: age 8-13
Term.Definition: Age ranges are indicative and may vary slightly in each country

Term.Name: age 14-15
Term.Definition: Age ranges are indicative and may vary slightly in each country

Term.Name: age 16-17
Term.Definition: Age ranges are indicative and may vary slightly in each country

Term.Name: age 18-20
Term.Definition: Age ranges are indicative and may vary slightly in each country

Term.Name: age 25-34
Term.Definition: Age ranges are indicative and may vary slightly in each country

Term.Name: age 35-44
Term.Definition: Age ranges are indicative and may vary slightly in each country

Term.Name: age 45-54
Term.Definition: Age ranges are indicative and may vary slightly in each country

Term.Name: age 55-64
Term.Definition: Age ranges are indicative and may vary slightly in each country

Term.Name: age 65+
Term.Definition: Age ranges are indicative and may vary slightly in each country

Term.Name: specific single age
Term.Definition: This section to be used where a programme targets one specific age Example: A programme targeted at those reaching the age to vote or retire.

Term.Name: Ethnic
Term.Definition: Programme for people differing in language and/or culture E.g. .Local key words to apply (ie Asian, )

Term.Name: Immigrant groups
Term.Definition: Programme for non-native born people and their immediate descendants, differing in language and/or culture.

Term.Name: Indiginous
Term.Definition: Programme for native born people and their immediate descendants, differing in language and/or culture.

Term.Name: Religious
Term.Definition: Local key words to apply (ie Shinto, Christian, Hindu etc)

Term.Name: Occupational Groups
Term.Definition: The occupation of the consumer for whitch the programme is primarely intended

Term.Name: A
Term.Definition: Opinion former, Judge, Member of the govt etc

Term.Name: B
Term.Definition: Industry leader, Senior Govt figure, Professionals (Doctors, Lawyers etc) etc

Term.Name: C1
Term.Definition: """White Collar worker"""

Term.Name: C2
Term.Definition: Skilled manual labourer

Term.Name: D
Term.Definition: General manual labourer

Term.Name: E
Term.Definition: Unemployed (+ students!)

Term.Name: OTHER SPECIAL INTEREST/OCCUPATIONAL GROUPS
Term.Definition: Local Keywords to apply. (ie Farmer, Student, DIY, Angler, Gay and lesbian,

Term.Name: GEOGRAPHICAL
Term.Definition: The territory for which the programme is primarily intended..

Term.Name: Universal
Term.Definition: Intended for all audiences regardless of territory

Term.Name: Continental
Term.Definition: Asia, European

Term.Name: National
Term.Definition: France, S Africa

Term.Name: Regional
Term.Definition: Mid West, Pacific Rim

Term.Name: Local
Term.Definition: Zip Codes, Postcodes, Towns

Term.Name: Single
Term.Definition: Single person with no dependants

Term.Name: Couple
Term.Definition: cohabiting adult with no dependants

Term.Name: Family with Children 0-3
Term.Definition: adult with pre school children

Term.Name: Family with Children 4-7
Term.Definition: adult with young children

Term.Name: Family with Children 8-15
Term.Definition: adult with older children

Term.Name: Family with Children 16+
Term.Definition: adult with young dependant adults

Term.Name: Empty Nester
Term.Definition: adult whose dependants have left home

Term.Name: Retired
Term.Definition: single or widowed adult whose dependants have left home
